result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar S. Amaya

2:02 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: B Harris, Defendant Oscar S. Amaya not in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Oscar S. Amaya.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF64 (PTC), 22CF325 (PTC), 22CF545 (PH), & 22CM273 (PTC).  Atty Satorius does not have an update as to where is client is.  State requests warrant.  Court issues WARRANT, extraditable from Adjoining States. Adjourned at 2:03 PM.  CASE RECALLED at 2:23 PM, appearances as previously noted, except DE in person.  Court QUASHES warrant.  As to 22CF545- Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Satorius states DE is willing to proceed to ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. ADA Ellenwood requesting DE to have contact with Kara R.  Court directs DE to meet with Kara R today.  Adjourned at 2:28 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:05 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Ali Casey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Oscar S. Amaya. Defendant Oscar S. Amaya appeared by video, in custody. Includes 22CF545- INIT, 22CM273, 22CF325, and 22CF64- RW. 22CF545: DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Bond argument. DE to contact PD office to see if DE qualifies. Court orders bond. Court sets PH. 22CM273, 22CF325, and 22CF64: Court quashes warrant and sets PTC.  Adjourned
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjoining States.  Includes 22CF325 and 22CM273. Signed by SJN on 07/20/22. arc  c: SCSO with complaint.   e: DA
DE did not appear at 3:30 in Hearing room 1, Court issues WARRANT for NON- Appearance.  Includes 22CM273 & 22CF325. bph

3:08 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Oscar S. Amaya not in court.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Satorius appears for today.  Includes 22CF325 & 22CM273. Court reviews files and notes there is confusion of whether or not DE qualifies for PD and that Atty Satorius only represents him on 22CF64.  Court will authorize warrant- STAYED until 3:30 today 7/8/22, if DE doesn't appear warrant will be in effect Extradite from Adjoining States. Adjourned at 3:26 PM. bph
of Absconder Status.  Includes 22CF64 and 22CF325. Filed by JSC S.Hilden. arc       Reviewed by SRN on 06/03/22. JA cc'd DA. arc
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF64 (STC-SJN file), 22CF325 (PH) and 22CM273 (STC):
Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Oscar S. Amaya appeared. Case called at 3:17 p.m. Court notes 22CF325 is scheduled for a preliminary hearing. 22CF64 is a Branch 1 file and further scheduling needed for preliminary hearing. Atty Satorius states 22CF325 will be a waiver. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Satorius would like to conduct arraignment today. ADA Ellenwood will file an information to mirror complaint. Atty Satorius enters a NG plea. Court directs Atty Satorius to do further scheduling with Branch 1 for a preliminary hearing on 22CF64. ADA Ellenwood states DE has not reported to JSC. Court directs DE to report directly to JSC after scheduling. Tina S. present in the courtroom and will accompany him down.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Includes 22CF325 and 22CM273.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:13 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today    DF:  Oscar S. Amaya appeared from jail. Includes 22CF325 INIT, 22CM273 INIT, 22CF64 RW. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. DE updates address and confirms DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights in 22CF325 and 22CM273. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG plea in 22CM273. Court QUASHES WARRANT and questions non-appearance in 22CF64. Atty Satorius states DE's father died. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets Preliminary Hearing.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
